meanings.definition: To raise or elevate to a higher position.
meanings.sent1: She lifted the heavy box onto the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The crane lifted the car effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: He lifted his spirits by listening to his favorite song.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lifted the gloomy atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The sun lifted above the horizon, signaling a new day.

meanings.definition: To steal or take without permission.
meanings.sent1: The thief lifted the wallet from the unsuspecting man.
meanings.sent2: She lifted a candy bar from the store without paying.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon lifted the picnic basket when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The magician lifted the watch from the volunteer's wrist without them noticing.
meanings.sent5: The pickpocket skillfully lifted the keys from the distracted tourist.

meanings.sent1: Adding fresh herbs lifted the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent2: The new paint color lifted the appearance of the room.
meanings.sent3: A good night's sleep can lift your mood for the whole day.
meanings.sent4: The motivational speech lifted the team's morale before the big game.
meanings.sent5: The uplifting music lifted everyone's spirits at the concert.

meanings.sent1: She lifted with joy when she received the good news.
meanings.sent2: The children's laughter lifted his heart.
meanings.sent3: Winning the competition lifted his confidence to new heights.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected compliment lifted her spirits instantly.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful sunset view lifted his soul and filled him with peace.
